text:
For any others that peek that don’t click through, there totally is a bug on our side (we thought we fixed but I guess didn’t or it regressed) where newly deployed JS module field changes don’t show up in the editor.

We’re on it, :im-on-it:

I encountered another <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-blocks-hello-world/issues/9|issue>. I am working on creating a CMS page using the new JS features, but issue <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-blocks-hello-world/issues/8|8> and <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-blocks-hello-world/issues/9|9> are blockers for me.
Alright, thanks, I'll wait to do it then but Tailwind support would make a huge difference
it's interesting that Vite will not automatically refresh the page for an update to a child component that lives inside of an island

Just wanted to double check to see if this is something that I should be careful around? My child component has state and is imported into a parent island component. That's allowed right? (seems to work)
:wave: - Relative to 9 ... there is not a way to in a _single_ command deploy the React part of the codebase and the HubL part at the same time.
I noticed in the TodoList island example props are passed to the button component but the button doesn't have state itself. Is that intentional / a limit?

That is, you need to upload the HubL portion using `hs upload` . In our scripts <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-blocks-hello-world/blob/main/package.json> we have provided both `deploy` for uploading the React code and `upload:hubl` for the HubL code.

> My child component has state and is imported into a parent island component. That's allowed right? (seems to work)
:yesyes: - This should be fine.
<@UAYBXDG4U> it would be cool if Vite would refresh the page like it does for the parent. Not a huge deal but I love the ability to break down components and hate refreshing :slightly_smiling_face:
Are you in a proxied context? i.e. a CMS page with a JS Building Block on it?
yea
Yeah, unfortunately, because of the proxied nature of the render - live reloading is not working properly in that scencario.
It is something we hope to find a solution for, and thank you for bringing it up.
If you view the module/partial with the island in a non-proxied context is the live-reloading working as expected?
let me try...I've done most things in a proxied context so I have to think about how else to look at this...
if you navigate to `localhost:3000`
do you see your list of partials/modules ?
yea
and then clicking into the component with the island?
yea, that live updates
thanks, that's helpful
Nice! We have some more things cooking relative to local development workflow. Hopefully we can push them out soon and make things smoother :slightly_smiling_face: .
And thanks again for going deep on this and providing feedback :heart: .
happy to help! definitely having fun

It is intentional (and is not due to a limit). The `Button` component itself has no state, but rather is the “trigger” for changes to state changes in `TodoList`.

And that happens via the `onClick` function passed from `TodoList` to `Button`…

```        <Button
          style={{ backgroundColor: buttonColor.color }}
          onClick={handleAddTodoClick}  // <---
          disabled={!todoInput}
        >```
sounds good thanks
